member.name: T:Microsoft.SilverlightMediaFramework.Core.SkippableMarkerManager`1
member.summary: Checks the status of markers.

remarks.para: This class tracks which markers have been reached, which markers have been left (when media playing has passed the end position of a marker), and which markers were skipped (due to the user seeking to a new position in the timeline, for example). This class raises the MarkerReached, MarkerLeft, and MarkerSkipped events respectively when these conditions occur.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SilverlightMediaFramework.Core.SMFPlayer
member.summary: Represents the area where video is displayed.

remarks.para: The Player uses a plug-in architecture so that the type of plug-in required to play a media clip (item in a Playlist) determines which plug-in is selected. For example, for a progressive download media clip, the Player will load a ProgressiveMediaPlugIn.

The Player has child controls including the BitrateMonitor, Timeline, and VolumeControl controls. These controls and the control strip (Play/Pause, FastForward, Rewind, and Stop buttons) and Playlist are displayed on the Player.
The Player has boolean properties you can check (for example, IsFullScreen, IsPlaylistVisible, IsAdPlaying) to determine the state of the Player.

There are several named parts (TemplateParts) defined for the Player. These allow a designer to completely redefine the appearance of the visual child controls of the Player with a completely customized appearance. Typically a designer will use a tool such as Expression Blend to define the look of the Player and its child controls.
Many visual states are defined for the Player that allow a designer to customize how the player will look in many different states, such as when an ad is playing or not playing.

Events occur when certain things happen in the Player, such as PlayStateChanged, MediaOpened, MediaFailed, and MarkerReached. You can write event handlers to do something when one of these events occur.

Many public methods have a [ScriptableMember] attribute allowing you to write code in JavaScript to control the player (for example, you can call the Play or Pause method). Properties decorated with a [ScriptableMember] attribute allow you to get the state of the Player from JavaScript code. Many of these properties have private setters, but some properties allow full read/write access, such as the Playlist property which you can use to access the current Playlist and its items or to set the property value to a new Playlist from your JavaScript code.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SilverlightMediaFramework.Core.SMFPlayer.OnKeyDown(System.Windows.Input.KeyEventArgs)
member.summary: Watches for certain key combinations to display additional information on screen.
member.remarks: The Alt-Ctrl-V key combination displays the Version Information window. The Alt-Ctrl-L key combination displays logging information.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SilverlightMediaFramework.Core.SMFPlayer.SelectMediaPlugin(Microsoft.SilverlightMediaFramework.Core.Media.PlaylistItem)
member.summary: Selects a MediaPlugin plugin that can play a specified Playlist item.
member.remarks: The PlaylistItem passed to this method is used to determine which type of IMediaPlugin to return. If more than one plugin can play the Playlist item (based on the required capabilities it lists in its attributes), the first plugin found that matches that item's play requirements in used. For the selection of which plugin to use if several match the requirements, a plugin already instantiated will take precedence over other plugins.
member.returns: An IMediaPlugin that can play the type of Playlist item passed as a parameter.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SilverlightMediaFramework.Core.SMFPlayer.SelectMarkerProvider(Microsoft.SilverlightMediaFramework.Core.Media.MarkerResource)
member.summary: Selects an IMarkerProvider plugin that supports the type of specified Marker.
member.remarks: The MarkerResource passed to this method is used to determine which type of MarkerProvider to return. If more than one plugin supports the MarkerResource (based on the required capabilities in its attributes), the first plugin found that matches the requirements in used. If more than one plugin matches the requirements, a plugin already instantiated will take precedence over other plugins.
member.returns: An IMarkerProvider that supports the type of marker passed as a parameter.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SilverlightMediaFramework.Core.SMFPlayer.SelectLogWriter(System.String)
member.summary: Queries the available plugins and selects an ILogWriter plugin.
member.remarks: The text passed to this method is used to determine which type of ILogWriter to return. If more than one plugin matches the requirements for the log writer (based on the comma-separated list of Log writers in its attributes), the first plugin found that matches the requirements in used. If more than one plugin matches the requirements, a plugin already instantiated will take precedence over other plugins.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SilverlightMediaFramework.Core.SMFPlayer.BeginAddExternalPlugins(System.Uri)
member.summary: Begins loading plugins from the .XAP file at the specified URI.
member.remarks:
This method calls the PluginsManager which loads any plugins in the .XAP file at the specified URI. The plugins will then be available for the application to use.
This method can be called at any time (rather than just at initialization of the Player). This method is not called automatically.
The AddExternalPluginsCompleted event is fired when loading plugins is done. The AddExternalPluginsFailed event is fired if there is an error loading the plugins.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SilverlightMediaFramework.Core.SMFPlayer.IsScrubbing
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the timeline is currently seeking to a new position.
member.remarks: When IsScrubbing is set to true the PlaybackPosition is not updated based on the current position of the underlying media element. This allows PlaybackPosition to be set via two-way data binding. When IsScrubbing is false, PlaybackPosition is updated using a timer interval to reflect the current media position.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SilverlightMediaFramework.Core.SMFPlayer.IsSlowMotionEnabled

member.name: P:Microsoft.SilverlightMediaFramework.Core.SMFPlayer.LogLevel
member.summary: Gets or sets the level for logging.

remarks.para: The LogLevel allows you to filter log messages that are written to the LogWriters. For example, you might set the LogLevel to LogLevel.Information in development, but use LogLevel.Errors in production to limit the number of log statements being generated in the Player and plug-ins for performance reasons.
The LogLevel also determines the severity of log messages displayed in the Log Window when Ctrl-Alt-L is pressed when the Player is displayed.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SilverlightMediaFramework.Core.SMFPlayer.LogWriters
member.summary: Gets or sets the current set of LogWriters to write logging information to.
member.remarks: The value of this property is a comma-separated list of LogWriters. The LogLevel determines the severity of log messages in order for them to be sent to the LogWriters.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SilverlightMediaFramework.Core.AdMarkerManager
member.summary: Checks the status of ad markers.

remarks.para: This class tracks which ad markers have been reached, which ad markers have been left (when media playing has passed the end position of an ad marker), and which ad markers were skipped (due to the user seeking to a new position in the timeline, for example). This class raises the MarkerReached, MarkerLeft, and MarkerSkipped events respectively when these conditions occur.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SilverlightMediaFramework.Core.Media.TimelineMediaMarker
member.summary: Represents a marker that can be displayed on the Timeline.

remarks.para: The position of a TimelineMediaMarker represents its specific time location in a media clip.

A display marker can have associated text that pops up when the user hovers over that marker in the timeline. A display marker can be clickable so if a user clicks on the marker, the current play position of the media jumps to that location and begins playing there.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SilverlightMediaFramework.Core.TimelineMarkerManager
member.summary: Checks the status of timeline markers.

remarks.para: This class tracks which timeline markers have been reached, which timeline markers have been left (when media playing has passed the end position of a timeline marker), and which timeline markers were skipped (due to the user seeking to a new position in the timeline, for example). This class raises the MarkerReached, MarkerLeft, and MarkerSkipped events respectively when these conditions occur.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SilverlightMediaFramework.Core.RetryMonitor
member.summary: Provides functionality to handle retrying logic when media fails to play.
member.remarks: Retrying begins after a MediaFailed event occurs. The RetryMonitor sets the Player IsRetrying property. An application can check the Player.IsRetrying property or databind to that property to change the appearance of the player in retrying mode.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SilverlightMediaFramework.Core.RetryMonitor.Dispose
member.summary: Releases the resources used by the RetryMonitor.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SilverlightMediaFramework.Core.RetryMonitor.BeginRetrying(System.Uri,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Begins retrying to re-establish connectivity to the media source.
member.param: Location of the media file (for progressive download only)
Indicates whether media is adaptive (the default is false).

member.name: M:Microsoft.SilverlightMediaFramework.Core.RetryMonitor.CancelRetrying
member.summary: Cancels retrying to re-establish a connection.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SilverlightMediaFramework.Core.RetryMonitor.IsRetrying
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the Player is currently in retry mode.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SilverlightMediaFramework.Core.RetryMonitor.MediaPlugin
member.summary: Gets or sets a media plugin.
member.remarks: If a connection is re-established, the IsRetrying property is set to false.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SilverlightMediaFramework.Core.Timeline
member.summary: Represents a control that shows a visual indicator of the duration of the current media and current position.
member.remarks: The Timeline has a collection of Markers that are loaded into the Timeline when a new media Playlist item is loaded. The Timeline keeps track of the current position, start position, and end position. These values are set each time a new media Playlist item is loaded.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SilverlightMediaFramework.Core.VersionInformation
member.summary: Displays an overlay of information on a client computer about the version of SMF running on that computer.
member.remarks: The information displayed about the client computer when a user presses Ctrl-Alt-V includes a listing of each assembly and loaded plug-in and their version numbers. This information can be useful for troubleshooting and diagnostics.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SilverlightMediaFramework.Core.VolumeControl
member.summary: Represents the Volume control on the Player.
member.remarks: The VolumeControl has visual states defined that allow a designer to customize the appearance of the control in various states (such as MouseOver, Muted, and Disabled) using an application such as Expression Blend.
